title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at GLL
Interview Descriptions: Just one stage and a panel of two. They were friendly, making me feel relaxed and confident with my response to their questions. The selection process was straightforward. They got back to me with the outcome in good time.
Interview Questions: What did you know about GLL

title: Concierge Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at GLL in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Study GLL company background. Friendly Interviewers. Try and answer every question even if confused. There was around 8 questions altogether about customer service/ scenario questions. Heard back within 2/3 weeks.
Interview Questions: What do you know about GLL?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at GLL (Belfast, Northern Ireland) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very straightforward. It was carried out by 2 managers of the company. They were very chatty and relaxed, they made me feel completely comfortable and at ease. They asked about 6 questions in relation to the role and the company and then asked about my own flexibility. Nothing to difficult, just do research on the company
Interview Questions: What do you know about GLL? How would you handle complaints? What skills and qualities do you have that would help you in this role?

title: Customer Service Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at GLL (Belfast, Northern Ireland) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Started with typing test and answering emails roleplay. main interview was 3 managers asking standard questions, although one of the interviewers from the Belfast branch was giggling like a schoolgirl so it made the whole thing uncomfortable.
Interview Questions: Give us a time you went above and beyond for a customer

title: General Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at GLL
Interview Descriptions: The two managers asked me several questions. They weren’t very hard and it was a very chill process. It was non threatening and they were friendly. They also asked what hours I’d be able to do.
Interview Questions: What do you think you’ll be doing on the job?

title: Fitness Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at GLL (London, England) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview offered after sign up. Went there, was a bit confused as no-one was waiting for me at the entrance. Regardless, interview went really well, most questions were about customer relations/service, but you must research the company.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to solve a problem.

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at GLL
Interview Descriptions: Relatively standard and slow paced - the interview is standard, with an unreasonable amount of time shadowing other members of staff, just to learn everyone fakes the jobs when cleaning
Interview Questions: What equipment do you need to carry out the role?

title: Library Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at GLL
Interview Descriptions: 6-8 questions covering a range of competencies, one wild card question, but overall a good balance for the many areas of expertise that the role covers. Felt very welcome and encouraged throughout.
Interview Questions: Something along the lines of how you would support staff through change.

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at GLL
Interview Descriptions: Sat down with 2 people and was questioned (took about 30 minutes) Was given instructions to do shelving non-fiction and fiction. (took about 30 mins) so 1 hour in total.
Interview Questions: When are you available as this job is quite flexible>

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at GLL (Belfast, Northern Ireland) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Was easy and informal, they two interviewing were laid back and asked about CV and my past experiences of lifeguarding and asked about my knowledge of  GLL, like schemes are run and tested my lifeguard knowledge. Then went on to do practical lifeguard display
Interview Questions: What is the role of a lifeguard?

title: Health Referrals Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at GLL (London, England) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: 2 rounds of interviews 1 hour long. I was offered interview via MS teams due to distance. Were willing to be flexible with times which was good. Standard questions on experience, translation of skills, and managerial questions.
Interview Questions: Previous Experience, transferable skills, what do you know about the company and why do you want to work for them, what do you think your role will be etc?

title: Customer Service Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at GLL
Interview Descriptions: Friendly general manager and front of house supervisor interviewed me, the process was around 30-45 minutes. The interview asked about myself and my experience, how my experience and skills related to the job role and what I knew about the company
Interview Questions: Tell us about GLL as a company?

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at GLL
Interview Descriptions: Just ask a few questions, why you would be suited to the job. Previous experience working in the health and leisure industry. How you would handle pressure and angry customers, double booking courts and that.
Interview Questions: What would you do if there was a double booking on court two?

title: Recreation Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at GLL (London, England) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was good not too stressful and the questions made sense and not tricky to answer. The interview lasted around 20 to 30 mins and the interviewer was nice and help explain questions i didn't understand.
Interview Questions: What are the duties of a life guard

title: Leisure Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at GLL (Cardiff, Wales) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Had an applicant day, Was fun and interactive with team building exercises such as building some structures and scenario based assessment. Followed by a written assessment coving further scenarios and situations. Which then proceeded into interviews. All round a very fun but thorough assessment.
Interview Questions: Alot of scenarios- such as incident in pool, chemical spillages etc

title: Casual Fitness Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at GLL
Interview Descriptions: Casual general skills questioning and practical teaching a group class element. Interview was given after a short phone call and took 1.5 weeks to get started in the job.
Interview Questions: What is great customer service?

title: Membership Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at GLL (London, England) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward process. 1 interview with manager, showed around the gym floor. Training took place on both membership desk and front of house desk. Got to ask questions and people were friendly.
Interview Questions: Typical interview Q's related to past experiences.

title: Recreation Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at GLL in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by two managers, both lovely and welcoming. Went into a room and was asked a variety of questions such as what do I know about the company,  why I wanted to do the job and what I knew about admissions policies.
Interview Questions: Situation question: If you have been asked to clean and set up equipment, which do you do first and why?

title: Customer Service Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at GLL (London, England) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Staring with an online application of qualifications, background check and questions based around knowledge of the company, followed by face to face interview if successful. Relatively short application process. Emailed with details of interview if successful.
Interview Questions: What do you know about GLL as an organisation?

title: Customer Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at GLL (Swindon, Wiltshire, South West England, England) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Great chilled interview good staff and good vibes no stress. They will give you a scenario and ask a tough situation that’s happened before in a workplace and you must answer in detail
Interview Questions: Do you have any work experience ?

title: Finance Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at GLL in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. I got an email of interview invitation. Two panel interview. It was normal. But one of interviewer yawned often  when l answered. Not nice and rude. I got some negative impression
Interview Questions: Tell about GLL

title: Graduate Scheme Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at GLL in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Assessment centre for a day in London, was pretty relaxed but mostly personalisation testing and the group size was very large, was difficult to gage what the job would entail they would tell you much
Interview Questions: What do you know about the company

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at GLL
Interview Descriptions: Quick, swim test & in person interview. There were quite a few people turning up that had little to no experience swimming. As long as you are somewhar competent you will be fine.
Interview Questions: What is you previous experience.

title: CSA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at GLL
Interview Descriptions:
Very quick and informal. With the General manager not actually doing the interview.
Was done by new assistant manager.
Felt like she wanted to help me relax but my Nerves always overtake me.
Lots of progression opportunities, with different departments needing cover and staff.
Interview Questions:
A sheet with about 12 questions on was asked. 

Equal opportunities meaning 

A time when Good service was given and feedback scenario 

What do you know about gll 

What way would you find out what a memeber/non member needs from membership.

title: Customer Service Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at GLL
Interview Descriptions: Attended one interview at headquarters with all the other candidates. Had a round of practical tests which everyone passed, and then a competency-based interview with three interviewers. The process took about six hours in total.
Interview Questions: What services do libraries offer apart from issuing books?

title: Fitness Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at GLL (London, England) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Two person panel, asking general questions with not much attention to detail on quality of knowledge but more box ticking. 

High turnover in staff with many casual roles offered to unsuccessful candidates.
Interview Questions: How have you benefitted someone you've worked with?

title: Customer Service Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at GLL (London, England) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Relaxed and informal with a few basic questions to understand your background. Followed by a few scenario questions to understand competence - such as what to do if certain situations arise in the workplace etc
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Casual Recreation Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at GLL (London, England) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: They were friendly and asked me if I knew about what the job entailed, described the duties, etc. It was pretty informal and chilled out, as long as you are a decent swimmer I'm pretty sure anyone could get this position.
Interview Questions: Do you know what this role involves?

title: Climbing Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at GLL (London, England)
Interview Descriptions: The interview took place on the local cafeteria, so positively informal and warming from the management. The interviewer went through the CV, asked some basic questions and explain the role's requirements in more details.
Interview Questions: What's your experience in rock climbing?

title: Customer Service Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at GLL (London, England) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was interview by two people. They both seemed inexperienced and after asking me a question they would start having a conversation amongst themselves. Not very good first impressions. No apology for making me wait and discussed completely irrelevant and innapropriate things during the interview.
Interview Questions: What do you expect to do in your role?

title: Graduate Trainee Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at GLL (Wythenshawe, England) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: A group task that involved reviewing the budgets of a leisure centre. Then presenting the findings. Then a interview revolving around business. And finally a written task where you reply to complaint about a leisure centre.  Very intimidating and not at all welcoming would not recommend working for GLL they do not care about staff just money!
Interview Questions: When have you set KPI (Key Performance Indicators?

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at GLL (London, England) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: A very tiring and long process took about 4 months to even get the interview in the first place. A very tiring and long process took about 4 months to even get the interview in the first place.
Interview Questions: A very tiring and long process took about 4 months to even get the interview in the first place. A very tiring and long process took about 4 months to even get the interview in the first place.

title: Catering Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at GLL (Swindon, Wiltshire, South West England, England) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Generally the entire process lasted a few weeks. At the interview I sat there and waited to be seen by the manager then we sat and had a chat and it was all very friendly and inviting.

Offered job straight away, sent application form in email.
Interview Questions: What do you know about GLL?

title: Gym Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at GLL in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: 2 stages, first was a really good informal chat with one of the other gym managers. The second was a pointless meeting with the general manager that lasted 5 minutes
Interview Questions: Why do you want to leave your current job?

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at GLL (London, England) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview, checking qualifications, skills experience and your personality, how far do you live from the workplace, to check if you are suitable for the position. Studies and qualifications, you must have the NPLQ qualification.
Interview Questions: What do you know about GLL?

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at GLL (London, England)
Interview Descriptions: apply on live- received a call and email to get the venue for the interview. Interview about 20 min long. following email to offer the job. They email you the job offer letter.
Interview Questions: your expectations, describe your role, equal opportunity

title: Customer Service Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at GLL (London, England) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied Online. Was asked to attend a recruitment day, that was to last from 9am - 5pm at a different leisure centre to the one I applied. There was a group of candidates, some who have applied to different positions or locations, so you're not in direct competition with them. The day was divided up into a group task, which is designed to test how you think and give them a better idea of who you are. This is followed by individual interviews. You should be aware that the role involves selling, where you are required to go out in the street and find prospective customers, something that isn't made clear in the job description
Interview Questions:
Tell me  little about yourself
What do you know about GLL
Tell me about a time where you have helped a customer
Why is diversity/equal opportunities important

title: Customer Service Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at GLL (London, England) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview went really good. I was a bit early but it better early than late. The interview was with the CSA Manager and another manager. A bit intimidating but just relax and know what you are saying. Make sure you know the Four Pillars and know the membership prices.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself ?

title: Health Facilitator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at GLL (London, England) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: well organised and 3  interviewers however final decision is made by regional manager follow a very structured approach which allows for a neutral result.  it takes over an hour
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Recreational Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at GLL (London, England) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Easy questions about what you expect of the role and how you would handle certain customers and situations, they also wanted to see what you knew about the company and how you would fit in with the current staff.
Interview Questions: What do you know about the company?

title: Customer Service Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at GLL (London, England) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer arrived an hour late. Told everyone it would be an "xfactor" style interview. Separated the group of people at the end into a yes or no category, people were allowed to watch while we were told no, after telling us no, a few of us were given a chance to interview for 5 mins as the interviewers decided they didn't really get to know anyone. I was told i was "lazy" with no reason, and told that if i apply for another branch id probably get it, but im not good enough for this particular center.
Interview Questions: Questions were a mess, we were asked irrelevant things like "If you were an animal,what would you be?". Interviewers couldn't decide what scripts to read from either.

title: Personal Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at GLL (Witney, England) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview itself was great, sadly however the information which was given was not accurate.  I feel like I was sold into the opportunity, which was not as described.  Vital information was with-held, for obvious reasons, such as for example the fact that the previous few PT's had failed in my location.
Interview Questions: Nothing difficult.  The one thing you should ask them is how the last PT got on, and if you can contact them!

title: Diving Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at GLL (Stratford, London, England) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: one on one. 30 mins long interview about skills previous coaching experience. Risk assesments and interest in coaching. Was very informal and easy. Whole application process took a week with 1 interview. Proof of coaching certification was needed.
Interview Questions: Q- What does GLL stand for?

title: Customer Service Agent Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at GLL (London, England) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Sent in CV, then had an interview with  a manager and a superior customer service assistant. Asked me questions on my CV,company information, and why i want/ would be good for the job
Interview Questions: Why would you be good for the job

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at GLL (London, England) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I have been invited to an office next to the swimming pool, where a duty manager and the general manager review my application. We started with introduction, then had to answer a couple of questions about health and safety, equal opportunities, emergency management etc.Then they asked about GLL and what I know about the company. They also asked about my former roles, where I had to describe my tasks and responsibilities. They were helpful and willing to take me in, the important part was to answer correctly to emergency management. I recommend everyone to revise how to save someone and how to communicate with coworkers in an emergency situation.
Interview Questions:
Why do you think equal opportunities is important?
What would you do first in an emergency if you are on duty as a Lifeguard?

title: General Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at GLL (London, England) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Online application followed by 2 on 1 interview, relaxed atmosphere 8 or 9 questions regarding previous experience. Was offered the job within 24 hours of the interview and they were flexible on when I could start
Interview Questions: management experience

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at GLL (London, England) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Swim tests followed by short interview.... often rushed with some sort of group interview. Not much talking to people who worked there.... they seem to just need lifeguards. Would recommend for students or summer work.
Interview Questions: tell me about a time you had to help a customer

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at GLL (Belfast, Northern Ireland) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online  through the GLL website. I was contacted soon after by email to arrange interview. There were two people on the panel 1 male 1 female. Interview lasted around 30 minutes but was not uncomfortable. Decision was made within a few days.
Interview Questions: What are the 4 pillars?

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at GLL in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: One interview with 2 managers. I applied for 2 centre so had 2 interviews. Both asked the exact some questions. You can't fail unless you really want too, or if you can't swim very well. The process of waiting for an interview was really drawn out, 2 months.
Interview Questions: why do you want the job? what is your past experience? what do you know about the company values? what is diversity and equality?

title: Sales Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at GLL (Buckingham, England) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Was awkward as they seemed to think I was there for a Lifeguard's vacancy. 2 interviewers, asking questions and taking notes. The usual interview staples like What do you know about GLL, Why did you apply? What can you bring to the company, Instances of providing excellent customer service and an informal Sales role play.
Interview Questions: One instance where you provided excellent Customer Service.

title: CSA Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at GLL (Hackney, England) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Long, they take forever to get back to you, two people interview you and they take forever to let you know the outcome, they hire you if they like the look of you
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you gave fantastic customer service and why you think it was fantastic

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at GLL (London, England) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was asked about fitness levels then was given a series of swimming tests involving bringing a dummy that had been sunk to the bottom of a pool to the surface, timed length swims, and training. The training was over two weeks.
Interview Questions: They tested my swimming ability and I was asked and tested on my first aid and life saving knowledge with practical tests and written. Questions like: What hazards do you need to be aware of and in what order would you administer CPR etc.

title: Customer Service Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at GLL (London, England) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Basic customer service skills questions
Previous  customer service experience 
Basic questions on sales & acieving targets
What interests you have about health & fitness
Previous experience in handling cash on tills
Working in a Team
Interview Questions: How do you exceed customer service?

title: CSA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at GLL (London, England) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: submitted Online application form then called in for a one to one Interview, then tour around office of selection and met with manager. If successful attend 1 Day intensive Learning centre to acquire knowledge about role, software and behaviour of organisation
Interview Questions: State a time you had to prioritise your task over a supervisor's task?

title: Partnership Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at GLL (High Wycombe, England) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Two stage. First stage with Head of Operations and outgoing Partnership Manager focussing mainly on knowledge and experience. Very fluid interview structure which worked to keep me from leading the process and really drilled down on my understanding of the businesses I had previously managed. Second stage with Regional Director and Regional Manager focussing mainly on commercial ability and seeking my vision for both the partnership and wider region.
Interview Questions: How would I change the culture of all six centres from operational to commercial in just six months?
